main event: A bright white light was observed in the sky near Springfield, Ohio on July 27, 1960. The light was stationary, oscillating or vibrating, and remained visible for approximately 20-30 minutes before disappearing.
interesting points: The object was initially approaching like an aircraft, but then maneuvered in an impossible way for a conventional aircraft.
The object moved erratically, making a dipping motion towards the moon, before disappearing behind a cloud.
A reddish-brown light also moved towards the Earth for a few seconds before going back up.
The witness was quite surprised and could not clearly make out the details, but felt the objects were not conventional aircraft.
The motion of the object was contrary to the normal west to east movement of the moon, adding to the unusual appearance.
